titleInfo.title: Yearbook of the Nashville College for Young Ladies, 1899

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: The complete 1899 yearbook publication of the Nashville College for Young Ladies. This institution was a leading Southern School for the advanced education of women. The campus, located on Broad and Vauxhall Streets, was comprised of three large brick buildings covering ½ acre of ground. These campus buildings were erected circa 1882, 1888, and circa 1890s. In September 1880, Rev. George W.F. Price, D.D., of Alabama, opened a school at his own expense on South Spruce Street with the assurance that if it proved successful the means would be forthcoming for its enlargement. The growth of the school steadily increased from 104 students in 1881 to 425 students in 1892. In November, 1882, Dr. Price’s School was removed to its new location on Vauxhall Street (Ninth Avenue South). Financial support was received from the Methodists of Nashville as a center of Southern Methodism. At one point later in time, Vanderbilt University bought the three buildings, converting two of them to apartments, locally known as the Vauxhall Apartments. The other building became the Vanderbilt School of Dentistry. In subsequent years the buildings were razed and the Federal Courthouse was established on the site. The advertisements in the yearbook are: E.B. Davis & Co., Pharmacists; Payne Stationery Co.; Cassetty Oil Co.; Home Insurance Company of Tennessee; McClure Drug Co.; John M. Ozanne Wholesale Baker, Confectioner, and Dealer; Geo. Zickler & Company; Joy & Son, Cut Flowers and Designs; Jungerman & Rust, Grocers; Faucon’s French Restaurant; Dury & Finney, Photo Stock House; Mitchell’s Fine Candies; Landis Banking Company; Warren Bros., Artists’ Materials; H.A. French, Music Publisher; The Ocean, Confectionary; Duncan R. Dorris, Bicycles and Sundries; Ward Seminary for Young Ladies; Frank G. Fite, Piano and Organs; DeMoville & Co., Prescriptions; Barnes Dry Goods & Shoe Co.; Tinsley’s, Millinery Store; Lebeck Brothers, Dry Goods, Tailor Made Suits and Millinary; Walter O. Winstead, Fine Footwear; Thos. W. Wrenne & Co., Bankers and Brokers; R. Dorman & Co., Pianos; C.W. Pate & Co.; Jesse French Piano & Organ Co.; Harry Arco; T. Tobias & Co., Calvert Bros. & Taylor, Photographers; Aldred’s Steam Dye Works and Cleaning Establishment; Geo. R. Calhoun & Co., Jewelers and Opticians; Bell Trunk Co.; Spurlock-Neal Co., Wholesale Druggists; Publishing House M.E. Church, South; Herrick & Page, Bicycles, Cameras, Kodaks, Supplies and Sundries; Yarbrough & Davis, Real Estate and General Agents; B.H. Stief Jewelry Co.; Fourth National Bank; Castner-Knott Dry Goods Co.; D. Loveman & Co., “Exquisite Millinery;” Thuss Photographers; and The Palace, “Millinery, Tailor-made Suits, Shirt Waists, Parasols, Ladies’ Furnishings.” Forms part of the Shannon Rigsby Collection, Nashville College for Young Ladies, 1899 “Talisman” Yearbook.
